page.title: 09Ages of Houses-Malpas Area
page.content: Housing estates are grouped along the A4042 road leading out of Newport to the North.The{houses nearest the town} centre are the{oldest,}being built in Victorian times. Crindau has{pre-1900} houses while{Pilton Vale}estate on the edge of our area was built in{the 1970 period.It shows building changes. The{1900}houses had{slate}roofs and chimneys.They were often built of{ {stone,}had sash windows and were built in rows.Houses built recently have tiles on the roofs and bigger windows. {Bettws}council{houses}were built around{1960.}Malpas Park houses with their brown tiles and open-plan gardens were too.Some of these are dormer bungalows. There have been{redevelopment}schemes in Crindau and Barrack Hill since{ {1980. } Karen Portal and Karen Dite 3S
